---
title: "gs_invalid.yml"
---

## High-level description
This YAML file represents an invalid configuration for Google Cloud Storage within a larger storage configuration. It demonstrates the structure for specifying object storage using Google Cloud, but it is intentionally incomplete or incorrect for testing purposes.

## Symbols

### `storage`
#### Description
The `storage` key is the root element of the configuration, defining the storage settings for the system.

#### Internal Logic
The `storage` configuration is structured with two nested levels:
1. `type`: Specifies the general type of storage, in this case, "object".
2. `object`: Contains the specific configuration for object storage.

### `storage.type`
#### Description
Specifies the general type of storage to be used.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| type | string | The type of storage, set to "object" in this case |

### `storage.object`
#### Description
Contains the configuration specific to object storage.

#### Internal Logic
The `object` configuration has one nested level:
1. `type`: Specifies the specific object storage provider.

### `storage.object.type`
#### Description
Specifies the object storage provider to be used.

#### Inputs
| Name | Type | Description |
|:-----|:-----|:------------|
| type | string | The object storage provider, set to "googlecloud" in this case |

## Configuration
| Option | Type | Default | Description |
|:-------|:-----|:--------|:------------|
| storage.type | string | N/A | Specifies the general type of storage (object) |
| storage.object.type | string | N/A | Specifies the object storage provider (googlecloud) |

## TODOs
This configuration file is intentionally invalid or incomplete, likely for testing purposes. It lacks necessary details for a complete Google Cloud Storage configuration, such as credentials, bucket name, or project ID. These missing elements would need to be added for a valid configuration.
